ECC Type = Non-ECC, Form Factor = UDIMM, Pin Count = 240-pin, PC Speed = PC3-12800, Voltage = 1.35V/1.5V, Rank and Configuration = 2Rx8
body.description: CT102464BD60B is a single 8GB DDR3L Desktop module that operates at speeds up to 1600 MT/s and has a CL11 latency. It is Unbuffered and is non-ECC. It is dual voltage and can operate at 1.35V or 1.5V. It conforms to the industry standard UDIMM layout of 240 pins and is compatible with computers that take DDR3L UDIMM memory. Each 240-pin DIMM provides a 64-bit data path (72-bit for ECC or registered or Fully Buffered modules).

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.7 4.7 out of 5 stars 3,828 ratings 4.7 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The fast, easy way to improve your desktop’s performance There’s an easy cure for a slow computer: more memory. Designed to help your system run faster and smoother, Crucial Desktop Memory is one of the easiest and most affordable ways to improve your system’s performance. Load programs faster. Increase responsiveness. Run data-intensive applications with ease, and increase your desktop’s multitasking capabilities.
Make everything on your computer faster Multitask with ease Easy to install Maximize the value of your system

Make everything on your computer faster The amount of memory in your system plays a critical role in the speed of loading apps, browsing the internet, and editing a spreadsheet. Add more memory for faster performance. Multitask with ease Every app you’re running requires memory and competes for a limited pool of resources. Overcome this by installing high-density modules in each memory slot for seamless multitasking.

Install with ease – no computer skills required With just a screwdriver, your owner’s manual, and a few minutes of time, you can install memory – no computer skills necessary. Maximize the value of your system At a fraction of the cost of a new system, a memory upgrade is one of the most affordable ways to increase performance. Get more out of your desktop by giving it the resources it needs to perform.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No compatibility or performance issues
reviews.reviewText: Installed fairly easy, immediately recognized by system, seems to add noticeable performance. No negative issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked perfectly in a Dell Inspiron 3650
reviews.reviewText: Great solution to add some extra speed to a Dell Inspiron 3650. If you've ever tried upgrading the RAM in one of these you might know that they're pretty picky about exactly what they'll take. You can buy most DDR3 1600 off the shelf at the box stores and it's not going to work. This did the trick though... two sticks brought the machine up to it's max 16gb of usable RAM.It's End Of Life on Crucial's own site so this is one of the few places you're going to be able to find it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for upgrade.
reviews.reviewText: Arrived quickly. Worked perfectly for my RAM upgrade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast, Instant, EASY Performance Upgrade Anybody Can Do!
reviews.reviewText: I have never witnessed the awesome performance upgrade that adding additional RAM to a PC can provide. Just WOW! The internet is becoming far more advanced with each passing day, and because of this simple, low memory tasks of that past are no more. Mostly everything requires lots of RAM, so if you only have 8GB of RAM you know the pain...So, after pulling my last hair out waiting for Google Chrome to load a webpage I decided to finally see if my PC was able to upgrade the RAM. Sho nuf!! I had 8GB installed and was expandable to 16GB so the decision was a no brainer. First of all, I couldn't believe how cheap RAM was...I was expecting to pay an arm and a leg for some reason...Anyway, if you have working fingers and are able to unscrew screws then you can do this, it's that simple! I managed my way inside my PC and popped out the two child's play 4GB RAM and stuck in the two brand new 8GB sticks giving me 16 total GB. My PC absolutely FLIES now!! I'm so mad I didn't do this earlier. It was so easy, so cheap, and the instant performance is unreal. Once you get the RAM installed in their slot, there is nothing else to do the PC software instantly recognizes the new RAM and takes over from there. I can't recommend doing RAM upgrade, especially for us lowly 8GB RAM plebes. Just do it, do it! Upgrade *if possible* and thank me later!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Not entirely sure, but my pc is not much faster than before when I only had 8 gigs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get them while they are still here...
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to upgrade our older Lenovo desktop from its standard 4 Gigs of ram.Crucial's tool for recommending memory upgrades got me the part number. Ipurchased this module via Amazon Marketing. Delivery was reasonable afterthe order was confirmed. The part appears to be new as other posters havewrote that end of life computer memory is often pulled out of computers.Installation was reasonably easy. Windows 10 recognized the memory and itappears that the pc is running a bit faster. I am holding the original 4 Gigs ofram as a fall-back. Thought about seeing if it would work along with the newram, but I don't think it will improve performance much more. Thanks Amazon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The ram fit perfectly and my computer booted up quickly. I am going to get another for the 2nd slot
Works fine, no problems. The nice thing was the manufacture's website that assesses your computer for upgrades, and what type. was helpful, saved a lot of questions.

Buen producto, lo recomiendo. Noté mucho la diferencia de rendimiento en mi pc, usaba una de 2 gb 😥 y cuando cambié a ésta wao ,, 🤩 anda a full.. Después de tanto investigar realicé una buena compra. Quedé satisfecha. 👌
Bien reçus le colis état parfait et emballage au point

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: Quick and easy to fit, Good value
reviews.reviewText: It appears that my old (10 yrs +) PC with hard disc drive was 'Disc Bound'. Under advice I changed out the hard drive for a Solid State Disc drive and upgraded the memory. I've used Crucial before and it's always given good service. The effect of this upgrade was surprisingly dramatic. Not only was it much faster but unexpectedly much more stable. Money well spent!
